20101230230510.000|20101230230513.000|TR0|them a kidney to get out of prison.  That

20101230230529.000|20101230230532.000|TR0|SAVIDGE (voice-over):  For years, family 
20101230230532.000|20101230230534.000|TR0|and supporters of Gladys and Jamie Scott 
20101230230534.000|20101230230536.000|TR0|have pleaded, prayed, and protested for 
20101230230536.000|20101230230539.000|TR0|their release from a Mississippi prison.
20101230230539.000|20101230230541.000|TR0|
20101230230541.000|20101230230543.000|TR0|The two were sentenced to life 16 years 
20101230230543.000|20101230230546.000|TR0|ago for armed robbery, a crime that netted 
20101230230546.000|20101230230548.000|TR0|$11.
20101230230548.000|20101230230551.000|TR0|
20101230230551.000|20101230230553.000|TR0|Wednesday, Governor Haley Barbour 
20101230230553.000|20101230230555.000|TR0|suspended their sentences, meaning the two 
20101230230555.000|20101230230558.000|TR0|could walk free in just days.  Their 
20101230230558.000|20101230230600.000|TR0|mother got the news in a phone call from a 
20101230230600.000|20101230230602.000|TR0|reporter.
20101230230602.000|20101230230605.000|TR0|
20101230230605.000|20101230230607.000|TR0|EVELYN RASCO, MOTHER:  I just went 
20101230230607.000|20101230230609.000|TR0|hysterical.  I had to stop the car.  I was 
20101230230609.000|20101230230612.000|TR0|driving at the time when he called me and 
20101230230612.000|20101230230614.000|TR0|I got so emotional thanking God that 
20101230230614.000|20101230230616.000|TR0|finally this has come to an end.
20101230230616.000|20101230230619.000|TR0|
20101230230619.000|20101230230621.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  Governor Barbour said he was not 
20101230230621.000|20101230230623.000|TR0|releasing the sisters because their 
20101230230623.000|20101230230626.000|TR0|sentences were too severe, but because the 
20101230230626.000|20101230230628.000|TR0|prison board said they were no longer a 
20101230230628.000|20101230230631.000|TR0|threat to society and for medical reasons.
20101230230631.000|20101230230633.000|TR0|
20101230230633.000|20101230230635.000|TR0|Thirty-eight year-old Jamie needs dialysis 
20101230230635.000|20101230230638.000|TR0|three times a week in prison.  Her 
20101230230638.000|20101230230640.000|TR0|36-year-old sister has offered one of her 
20101230230640.000|20101230230642.000|TR0|own kidneys for transplant.  The governor 
20101230230642.000|20101230230645.000|TR0|says the operation is part of the

20101230230833.000|20101230230835.000|TR0|move in with mom in Florida, state

20101230230901.000|20101230230904.000|TR0|
20101230230904.000|20101230230906.000|TR0|For more on this, we are joined by 
20101230230906.000|20101230230908.000|TR0|criminal defense attorney Midwin Charles 
20101230230908.000|20101230230911.000|TR0|from the firm Midwin Charles and 
20101230230911.000|20101230230913.000|TR0|Associates in New York.
20101230230913.000|20101230230915.000|TR0|
20101230230915.000|20101230230918.000|TR0|Thanks for joining us here in THE 
20101230230918.000|20101230230920.000|TR0|SITUATION ROOM.
20101230230920.000|20101230230923.000|TR0|
20101230230923.000|20101230230925.000|TR0|MIDWIN CHARLES, LEGAL COMMENTATOR:  Sure.
20101230230925.000|20101230230927.000|TR0|
20101230230927.000|20101230230930.000|TR0|MALVEAUX:  I have to say, I just don't 
20101230230930.000|20101230230932.000|TR0|understand this.  How does the governor, 
20101230230932.000|20101230230934.000|TR0|first of all, make the organ transplant, 
20101230230934.000|20101230230937.000|TR0|kidney transplant of one sister to another 
20101230230937.000|20101230230939.000|TR0|a stipulation for parole or release?  Is 
20101230230939.000|20101230230941.000|TR0|this legal?  Is this ethical?  What is 
20101230230941.000|20101230230944.000|TR0|going on?
20101230230944.000|20101230230946.000|TR0|
20101230230946.000|20101230230948.000|TR0|CHARLES:  Good question, Suzanne.
20101230230948.000|20101230230951.000|TR0|
20101230230951.000|20101230230953.000|TR0|This is highly unorthodox, and I have 
20101230230953.000|20101230230956.000|TR0|never, ever heard of a governor requiring 
20101230230956.000|20101230230958.000|TR0|such a condition.  Yes, conditions are 
20101230230958.000|20101230231000.000|TR0|often attached to clemency and pardons and 
20101230231000.000|20101230231003.000|TR0|such, but never one of this magnitude, but 
20101230231003.000|20101230231005.000|TR0|I think perhaps there might be a 
20101230231005.000|20101230231007.000|TR0|oversimplification of it.
20101230231007.000|20101230231010.000|TR0|
20101230231010.000|20101230231012.000|TR0|After all, I believe he may have put that 
20101230231012.000|20101230231014.000|TR0|stipulation in after the sister came 
20101230231014.000|20101230231017.000|TR0|forward and said that she was willing to 
20101230231017.000|20101230231019.000|TR0|volunteer her kidney for her sister.  So, 
20101230231019.000|20101230231021.000|TR0|I don't think that it is a draconian as it 
20101230231021.000|20101230231024.000|TR0|sounds.
20101230231024.000|20101230231026.000|TR0|
20101230231026.000|20101230231029.000|TR0|MALVEAUX:  Is it enforceable?
20101230231029.000|20101230231031.000|TR0|
20101230231031.000|20101230231033.000|TR0|CHARLES:  I don't know believe it is 
20101230231033.000|20101230231036.000|TR0|enforceable.  Prisoners do not have the 
20101230231036.000|20101230231038.000|TR0|same amounts of rights that we do.  They 
20101230231038.000|20101230231040.000|TR0|don't have the same amount of 4th 
20101230231040.000|20101230231043.000|TR0|Amendment rights and what have you, and 
20101230231043.000|20101230231045.000|TR0|they have a limited amount of privacy when 
20101230231045.000|20101230231047.000|TR0|it comes to prison.
20101230231047.000|20101230231050.000|TR0|
20101230231050.000|20101230231052.000|TR0|But they cannot be forced or subjected to 
20101230231052.000|20101230231054.000|TR0|surgery.  And there have been cases about 
20101230231054.000|20101230231057.000|TR0|this, particularly when law enforcement 
20101230231057.000|20101230231059.000|TR0|has been looking for evidence inside the 
20101230231059.000|20101230231102.000|TR0|body of a prisoner.  And even then -- this 
20101230231102.000|20101230231104.000|TR0|case came up in the First Circuit -- the 
20101230231104.000|20101230231106.000|TR0|court had overruled that surgery and said

20101230231109.000|20101230231111.000|TR0|proof that the evidence they were

20101230235032.000|20101230235034.000|TR0|started, but April 5 Galaxy 15 became a

20101230235037.000|20101230235039.000|TR0|flying out there.  They couldn't 
20101230235039.000|20101230235041.000|TR0|communicate with it.  It was an old 
20101230235041.000|20101230235044.000|TR0|communications satellite shot up in 2005.  
20101230235044.000|20101230235046.000|TR0|It had been working great.  It was 
20101230235046.000|20101230235048.000|TR0|supposed to work until 2020.
20101230235048.000|20101230235051.000|TR0|
20101230235051.000|20101230235053.000|TR0|Well, all of a sudden, during a solar 
20101230235053.000|20101230235055.000|TR0|storm, we lost communication with this 
20101230235055.000|20101230235058.000|TR0|thing.  So nobody could talk to it.  But 
20101230235058.000|20101230235100.000|TR0|there is so much junk out there, so many 
20101230235100.000|20101230235102.000|TR0|other satellites, that they were afraid, 
20101230235102.000|20101230235105.000|TR0|at least, that it could get in the way of 
20101230235105.000|20101230235107.000|TR0|some of the other communications 
20101230235107.000|20101230235110.000|TR0|satellites that we actually do use.
20101230235110.000|20101230235112.000|TR0|
20101230235112.000|20101230235114.000|TR0|Look at all the ones.  Spin around.  
20101230235114.000|20101230235117.000|TR0|Everywhere you see a name on there, all of 
20101230235117.000|20101230235119.000|TR0|those names are real satellites in real 
20101230235119.000|20101230235121.000|TR0|orbit.  Well, Galaxy 15 is the one.  This 
20101230235121.000|20101230235124.000|TR0|is a 4,000-pound satellite that they lost 
20101230235124.000|20101230235126.000|TR0|communication with.  And it was still 
20101230235126.000|20101230235128.000|TR0|sending out signals.  So they thought, 
20101230235128.000|20101230235131.000|TR0|maybe it could get in the way of other 
20101230235131.000|20101230235133.000|TR0|satellites that were sending out signals 
20101230235133.000|20101230235135.000|TR0|and really kind of disrupt some 
20101230235135.000|20101230235138.000|TR0|communication. Well, it never did that.  
20101230235138.000|20101230235140.000|TR0|It was always kind of under some control.
20101230235140.000|20101230235143.000|TR0|
20101230235143.000|20101230235145.000|TR0|Well, the batteries died.  That was 
20101230235145.000|20101230235147.000|TR0|perfect, because the batteries died.  It 
20101230235147.000|20101230235150.000|TR0|reset itself.  It pointed itself back, and 
20101230235150.000|20101230235152.000|TR0|it woke itself back up just a couple days 
20101230235152.000|20101230235154.000|TR0|ago.  And now we're actually talking back 
20101230235154.000|20101230235157.000|TR0|and forth with it, the company that made 
20101230235157.000|20101230235159.000|TR0|it is.  It's in safe mode right now.
20101230235159.000|20101230235201.000|TR0|
20101230235201.000|20101230235204.000|TR0|But here's how it all happened.  When -- 
20101230235204.000|20101230235206.000|TR0|when you get a solar storm or a solar 
20101230235206.000|20101230235208.000|TR0|flare, this energy comes flying out of the 
20101230235208.000|20101230235211.000|TR0|sun.  It's called a coronal mass ejection 
20101230235211.000|20101230235213.000|TR0|or CME.  Well, back in April, we had one.  
20101230235213.000|20101230235216.000|TR0|And it shot this mass or these particles 
20101230235216.000|20101230235218.000|TR0|toward the satellite. And as it happened, 
20101230235218.000|20101230235220.000|TR0|all of a sudden, the satellite was seeing 
20101230235220.000|20101230235223.000|TR0|and hearing so much junk from space it 
20101230235223.000|20101230235225.000|TR0|lost communications with what it was 
20101230235225.000|20101230235227.000|TR0|actually supposed to be talking to.
20101230235227.000|20101230235230.000|TR0|
20101230235230.000|20101230235232.000|TR0|And these particles can actually destroy 
20101230235232.000|20101230235234.000|TR0|satellites, as well. This didn't get 
20101230235234.000|20101230235237.000|TR0|destroyed.  We talk about these solar 
20101230235237.000|20101230235239.000|TR0|storms all the time.  They can do this.  
20101230235239.000|20101230235241.000|TR0|Well, this is the first one that I 
20101230235241.000|20101230235244.000|TR0|actually know actually could have done

20101230235359.000|20101230235402.000|TR0|
20101230235402.000|20101230235404.000|TR0|MALVEAUX:  It's really fascinating.  And 
20101230235404.000|20101230235406.000|TR0|as Chad mentioned, the Galaxy 15, it's one 
20101230235406.000|20101230235409.000|TR0|of 3,500 satellites in orbit right now 
20101230235409.000|20101230235411.000|TR0|with only about a third of those being 
20101230235411.000|20101230235413.000|TR0|operational.  But satellites only make up 
20101230235413.000|20101230235416.000|TR0|only a fraction -- a fraction of the 
20101230235416.000|20101230235418.000|TR0|objects that are circling the earth that 
20101230235418.000|20101230235420.000|TR0|are monitored by the Global Space 
20101230235420.000|20101230235423.000|TR0|Surveillance Network. And using telescopes 
20101230235423.000|20101230235425.000|TR0|and radars around the world, the agency 
20101230235425.000|20101230235427.000|TR0|keeps track of about -- can you imagine 
20101230235427.000|20101230235430.000|TR0|this -- 22,000 objects that are orbiting 
20101230235430.000|20101230235432.000|TR0|us right now.  Absolutely amazing.
20101230235432.000|20101230235435.000|TR0|
20101230235435.000|20101230235437.000|TR0|Well, more and more big-name celebrity 
20101230235437.000|20101230235439.000|TR0|couples are taking a page out of one of 
20101230235439.000|20101230235442.000|TR0|America's most popular TV shows, ABC's 
20101230235442.000|20101230235444.000|TR0|"Modern Family."
20101230235444.000|20101230235446.000|TR0|
20101230235446.000|20101230235449.000|TR0|(COMMERCIAL BREAK)
20101230235449.000|20101230235451.000|TR0|
20101230235451.000|20101230235453.000|TR0|MALVEAUX:  Elton John is the latest 
20101230235453.000|20101230235456.000|TR0|well-known gay celebrity to embrace 
20101230235456.000|20101230235458.000|TR0|parenthood.  And it looks like he's 
20101230235458.000|20101230235500.000|TR0|joining a trend.  Let's head out to Los 
20101230235500.000|20101230235503.000|TR0|Angeles.  Our entertainment correspondent 
20101230235503.000|20101230235505.000|TR0|Kareen Wynter's got the story.

20101230235508.000|20101230235510.000|TR0|Hey, Kareen.

20101230235524.000|20101230235526.000|TR0|Jackson Levon Furnish-John.  He was born 
20101230235526.000|20101230235529.000|TR0|on Christmas day.  But this high-profile 
20101230235529.000|20101230235531.000|TR0|couple, they have a lot in common with a

20101230235541.000|20101230235543.000|TR0|WYNTER (voice-over):  They made headlines 
20101230235543.000|20101230235545.000|TR0|when they tied the knot in 2005.  Now 
20101230235545.000|20101230235548.000|TR0|Elton John and husband David Furnish have 
20101230235548.000|20101230235550.000|TR0|stolen the spotlight again.  They're proud 
20101230235550.000|20101230235552.000|TR0|new papas.  John and Furnish welcomed a 
20101230235552.000|20101230235555.000|TR0|new baby boy on Christmas day delivered 
20101230235555.000|20101230235557.000|TR0|via a surrogate.
20101230235557.000|20101230235559.000|TR0|
20101230235559.000|20101230235602.000|TR0|The Rocket Man and Furnish join a growing 
20101230235602.000|20101230235604.000|TR0|trend of gay and lesbian celebs who have 
20101230235604.000|20101230235606.000|TR0|launched into the world of parenthood, 
20101230235606.000|20101230235609.000|TR0|once a taboo topic in Hollywood.  "People" 
20101230235609.000|20101230235611.000|TR0|magazine's Joey Bartelomeo said this trend 
20101230235611.000|20101230235614.000|TR0|is reflective of society as a whole.
20101230235614.000|20101230235616.000|TR0|
20101230235616.000|20101230235618.000|TR0|JOEY BARTELOMEO, "PEOPLE" MAGAZINE:  We're

20101230235621.000|20101230235623.000|TR0|because the country itself has become more 
20101230235623.000|20101230235625.000|TR0|open to gay parents having kids and 
20101230235625.000|20101230235628.000|TR0|especially in Hollywood.  It really just 
20101230235628.000|20101230235630.000|TR0|seems kind of natural for everyone now.

20101230235651.000|20101230235654.000|TR0|not getting much sleep these days but have 
20101230235654.000|20101230235656.000|TR0|embraced their new roles.  Harris tells 
20101230235656.000|20101230235658.000|TR0|"People," quote, "I just love the way they 
20101230235658.000|20101230235701.000|TR0|smell, and we can use them as an excuse to 
20101230235701.000|20101230235703.000|TR0|get out of almost anything."
20101230235703.000|20101230235705.000|TR0|
20101230235705.000|20101230235708.000|TR0|Another star, Ricky Martin, may have lived 
20101230235708.000|20101230235710.000|TR0|la vida loca for years.  But he's now
